Author.Comment: Changed some hyperlinks to point to new HTML pages from new website for GenoPro 2007

Author.Name: GenoPro
Author.Comment: Gender-based phrases and name tag definitions

Author.Name: GenoPro
Author.Comment: More Dictionary based phrases and NameDictionary to aid translation

bodydonation.T: body was donated for medical research

Other.T: body disposition was by some other unspecified means

Natural.T: due to natural causes or old age

RespiratoryOrPneumonia.T: due to a respiratory problem and/or pneumonia

Accident.T: in an accident or as a result of an injury

Miscarriage.T: as a result of a miscarriage

NaturalHazards.T: as a result of a natural hazard (e.g. earthquake, volcano, wildfire, flood or Tsunami)

Questionable.T: evidence of questionable reliability (interviews, census, oral genealogies, or potential for bias for example, an autobiography)

Secondary.T: secondary evidence, data officially recorded sometime after event

Primary.T: direct and primary evidence used, or by dominance of the evidence

Professional.T: on a professional or technical study course

LegalCohabitationAndSeparation.T: Legal cohabitation and separation in fact

Accommodation.T: accommodation / travel (hotel, camping, trip, vacation, visit a friend)

WorkPlaceAndPrimaryResidence.T: work place and primary residence (eg: farm, work at home)

EndOfContract.T: left at the end of the contract

EmployerClosed.T: left due to the business being closed down

EmployerBankruptcy.T: left when the company was declared bankrupt

Landscape.T: a landscape feature (island, mountain, desert, valley, etc.)

TransportationFacility.T: a transportation facility (train, bus, car, ship, plane, horse, carriage, bicycle, etc.)

Waters.T: a body of water (ocean, sea, lake, river, etc.)

AltDefault.T: Learn how to build your Family Tree

SK.Alt: Learn about a powerful genealogy software capable of drawing the most complex family tree
Software to record all the details on your ancestry research
Learn how to start building your genealogy tree within minutes
Learn pedigree symbols using this powerful software
Learn the various components of the genogram
Learn how to create simple and complex genograms
Sample genogram templates you can use
Examples of a wide variety of sample genograms. See the different uses of the concepts and genogram symbols
Step-by-step method to create a genogram
To help and heal family and personal troubles
To understand and accept individual responsibility in the emotional functioning of the family unit

SK.T: View a family tree from Gedcom file
SK.Alt: Discover the only software capable of creating a graphical pedigree tree from your Gedcom file
Import your Gedcom and create a graphical family tree

SK.T: Publish my family tree on the web

SK.Alt: Logiciel pour créer votre arbre généalogique

ChildBiological_.C1: an biological child of unknown gender

ChildAdopted_.C1: an adopted child of unknown gender

ChildFoster_.C1: a foster child of unknown gender

SiblingAdopted_.C1: an adopted sibling of unknown gender

SiblingFoster_.C1: a foster sibling of unknown gender

FmtHtmlHomeScripts.T:
If you are reading this text, it is because your web browser is not running scripts for this report. Your browser probably displays the following message:
"To help protect your security, Internet Explorer has restricted this file from showing active content that could access your computer".

Instead of always clicking on "Allow Blocked Content...", follow this link to enable IE to display active content your computer.

FmtSvgHelpBody.T:
Help on viewing this genogram displayed using Scaleable Vector Graphics (SVG)

Introduction

These Web pages use SVG (Scaleable Vector Graphics) format to display images of the family tree. You will need an SVG Viewer plug-in for browser in order to view them.

The Mozilla Firefox browser for Windows, Linux and Mac platforms has native support for SVG from version 1.5 Beta and above and can be used to view and manipulate these family tree images.

If you are using Microsoft's Internet Explorer and the family tree graphic is not shown, please install Adobe SVG Viewer 3.0x in order to get the best presentation.

Mozilla Firefox browser can also recognise the Adobe SVG Viewer provided you copy the necessary NPSVG3.dll from the Adobe directory to the plugins-directory. (normally from C:\Program Files\Common Files\Adobe\SVG Viewer 3.0\Plugins to C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\plugins after you have downloaded and installed it. You will also need to access the Firefox configuration parameters (type about:config in the address line and press enter) and set svg.enabled to false to turn off the internal SVG Engine.

Zooming and Panning

You can zoom in and out of the image using the and icons. Clicking the icon will return the image to its original size. You can see the whole of this image on a small scale by clicking the icon. The diagram can be panned/scrolled by clicking the green arrows around the border

Displaying information on Individuals & Families

You can obtain more information about each individual by clicking the gender icon above their name (box for male, circle for female). Family details can be obtained by clicking the horizontal line joining the parents and children. In both instances the information is displayed in the frame above the genogram.

Moving for one family tree diagram (genogram) to another

The genogram may be split between several different diagrams. The linking individual will appear on both diagrams and the name of that individual will be displayed in blue to indicate a 'hyperlink' between the two diagrams. Clicking on this hyperlink will cause the linked diagram to be displayed, centred on the linking individual.

Centering the family tree diagram on a particular individual or family

Locate the required individual or family in the individual index or family index in the left hand frame. N.B. Click the or icon to display the appropriate index. Click the required individual or family to display their details in the upper right frame. Finally click the icon alongside their name to display the family tree diagram centered on that individual or family.

External Links

Some individuals in the diagram may have links to external pages. These are indicated by the individual's name being displayed in violet. Clicking such a name will cause the link to open in a new browser window.

FmtTagChange.T: Warning: [Dictionary Tag {1} has been replaced from version {!3} by ]Tag {0}[{?!1} introduced at version {3} is missing from Dictionary and has been defaulted to '{2}]'

ShowPdfTip.T: Display as PDF PDF (Portable Document Format) requires a PDF Reader plugin, for best compatibility use Adobe Reader 8.1.2 or above. Provides easy pan, zoom & print features, but lacks hyperlinks and mouseover datatips of SVG.

ShowSvgTip.T: Display as SVG SVG (Scaleable Vector Graphics) format requires either Firefox browser or Adobe SVG Viewer installed. Has hyperlinks to detail pages for individuals and families but panning & zooming can be slow, particularly with large genograms or Firefox browser. Not good for printing.

CustomTagLayoutDefault.T: A custom tag is a generic placeholder

PedigreeChartFootNote.T: There are earlier generations for the ancestor(s) indicated. See their page(s) for details (click name)

PictureDetailsTip.T: Click for more information on this picture

PictureMapHint.T: N.B. Hover over features such as faces for details then click for further information where available

PictureMessage.T: Click on photos/images to display a larger version.

TimelineHelp.T: N.B. For help on use please click here

TimelineHelpDetails.T: After clicking on the timeline, drag it with mouse or click and use keys as follows: 'Home' to move to the start, 'End' to move to the end, 'Page Up' & 'Page Down' to scroll left & right a screenful at a time or arrow keys to scroll by small amounts. Click the person's or couple's name to get an information bubble like this one. Click the title of the bubble to see more of that person's or couple's details.

gMapMissingAddress.T: Missing Address: The address was either missing or had no value.

gMapUnavailableAddress.T: Unavailable Address: The geocode for the given address cannot be returned due to legal or contractual reasons.

gMapBadKey.T: Bad Key: The API key is either invalid or does not match the domain for which it was given

gMapServerError.T: Server error: The geocoding request could not be successfully processed.
